items.title: Easy Trip Planners' CEO Nishant Pitti resigns citing 'personal reasons'
items.description: EaseMyTrip is the brand operated by the listed Easy Trip Planner. Shares worth Rs 53 crore of Easy Trip were sold in a block deal on December 31, with co-founder Nishant Pitti being the seller.

items.title: Muthoot Finance – How long will it shine?
items.description: Gold loan demand remains robust aided by RBI diktat on unsecured lending

items.title: Defence Ministry targets 2025 to be 'year of reforms', Rajnath Singh says focus on cyber and space domains
items.description: The focus will also be on positioning India as a 'credible exporter' of defence products, and encourage more public-private partnerships, said the Ministry.

items.title: Nippon Life India MF investors lost over Rs 1,800 crore due to Yes Bank AT-1 bond exposure, says Sebi
items.description: Sebi's allegation of a quid pro quo are significant and the regulator has sought an explanation from Nippon Life India MF as to why the management fee of Rs 88.60 crore that the AMC earned should not be disgorged, along with a possible debarment for an 'appropriate period'.

items.title: Airlines instructed to reduce passenger inconvenience during fog-related disruptions
items.description: Conducted over past two months, these discussions with stakeholders are aimed at streamlining the travel experience, reduce delays, and offer a smoother and more efficient journey, including during peak hours affected by weather disruptions.
